page.title: 09OLD PEOPLE REMEMBER MARSDEN
page.content: Mrs Carr is our dinner lady.She looks after us when we eat our dinners at school. She told us that when she was a little girl that shops used to have groceries on the shelves and that if you wanted anything you had to go into the shop and ask the person behind the counter to get it for you.The coalman came round with a horse abd cart,and there were hardly any lorries or cars.People didn't have calculators and they had to add things up in their heads.People travelled on trams,and trolley buses. Ladies wore hats with feathers in them, and very long dresses.She has lived in Marsden all her life and went to this school when she was our age. {Tracy Shaw and Rosemary McDonald.
